Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_sample_reverb

The function AIL_set_sample_reverb changes the simple reverb settings of a digital audio sample.

void AIL_set_sample_reverb(
  HSAMPLE S,
  F32 reverb_level,
  F32 reflection_time,
  F32 reverb_decay_time
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample whose reverb is to be set.
reverb_level
specifies the amount of reverb to apply from 0.0F (no reverb) to 1.0F (maximum reverb).
reflection_time
specifies the time in seconds between the reflections.
reverb_decay_time
specifies the approximate time in seconds for the reflection to die out.

Discussion

The Miles DSP Reverb filters usually sound much, much better than this "simple" type of echo-ish reverb. Simple reverb is faster, though.

You must open the digital driver with reverb for this function to have any effect (see the DIG_REVERB_BUFFER_SIZE preference).

Reverb requires CPU time to apply - how much depends on the reflection time (shorter is slower) and decay time (longer is slower). Short reflection periods with long decay time are the worst CPU eaters. You can monitor the CPU use with the AIL_digital_CPU_percent function.

You can use this function even if you haven't started playback yet.
